result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Wayne Seehaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Electric Weapon, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.295(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Wayne Seehaver in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.   Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DEF pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  Sentence withheld, DEF placed on 2 years probation, Conditions of probation:  NO CONTACT with the Honor the Earth Pow Wow;  Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent;  Pay fine/court costs totalling $906.00 which includes $250 DNA surcharge.
Counts #2 and #3 Dismissed but Read In.
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief.
Probable cause found.  Not guilty pleas entered for all counts.

Defendant Richard Wayne Seehaver in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to prelim.    Acknowledges receipt of information.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard Wayne Seehaver appeared by phone in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.    Counsel entered NG Plea on Counts 2 & 3.   DEF waives time limits for Preliminary hearing.  Counsel advised DEF he must appear in person at the preliminary hearing.   Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of motion & motion & demand for discovery and inspection

Attorney Martin Jarvis in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF in Custody in Dunn County Jail.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bruce Poquette appeared for the State before Commissioner Winton. Defendant Richard W Seehaver appeared in custody, by video. DEF is satisfied with video. Probable cause previously found by Judge Wright w/exception of probation violation. Commissioner request that jail personnel provide medical attention for DEF and contact probation. Next appearance: 8/18/15 @ 8:30 for Initial Appearance.
